intro: Mammillaria coahuilensis subsp. albiarmata, commonly known as the white-armed hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the Chihuahuan Desert in northern Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white to pale green spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 centimeters and has a rounded, segmented stem. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in late spring or early summer. This subspecies is well adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water and reduce transpiration.
